title: 111_hr5147
content: The "Airport and Airway Extension Act of 2010" extends fuel and ticket taxes funding the Airport and Airway Trust Fund until July 3, 2010. The amendments made by this Act will take effect on May 1, 2010. Additionally, the Act extends the expenditure authority of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund. The Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change dates and include the Airport and Airway Extension Act of 2010. The effective date for these amendments is May 1, 2010. Additionally, the Airport Improvement Program is extended with an authorization of appropriations until July 3, 2010. The amendment allows funds to remain available until expended. The Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration must calculate funding apportionments and reduce them by 17 percent for fiscal year 2010. Project grant authority is also addressed in the section. The text chunk provides amendments to various sections of title 49, United States Code, extending expiring authorities to new dates in 2010. The text chunk contains amendments to various sections of title 49, United States Code, extending expiring authorities to new dates in 2010 for Federal Aviation Administration operations and air navigation facilities and equipment. Amendments to title 49, United States Code extend funding for Federal Aviation Administration operations and air navigation facilities until July 3, 2010. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
